job_title: Alumni Assistant/Assistant Woman's Basketball Coach in Hillsboro, KS
pros: Excellent benefits including up to 4 weeks of paid vacation, health and dental insurance, and matching contributions to retirement funds. Friendly co-workers and supervisors. Management engages with employees and truly cares about their concerns. Out of all the places I've worked, I enjoyed working at Tabor College the most. I only left because my wife wanted to move closer to her family.
cons: I honestly can't think of any cons.

review_title: Some things are fine, most are not
pros: The employees are great, and the town is a nice community.
cons: Overworked and underpaid. Big time. Subpar leadership Exploits workers and volunteers to a point it benefits no one

pros: Community, colleagues, programs, small town, students
cons: Workload, small town, finances, support, advancement

pros: Tabor is full of wonderful people.
cons: Too much work and not enough money. Tabor doesn't have the financial resources to pay its faculty competitive salaries, let alone hire additional faculty to reduce the workload. The administration occasionally micromanages faculty. The responsibilities outside of the classroom are not always clear. There has been a significant turnover in recent years. Significant institutional knowledge has been lost. It feels like we're reinventing the wheel because of this.

pros: Working with the people is great.
cons: We're overworked and underpaid. Though, this is pretty typical for smaller schools.

pros: Small town living is nice sometimes
cons:
Underpaid, overworked
Too much micromanaging
Long hours is something they take pride in

pros: Family atmosphere, great community, good references
cons: Expense is extremely high, there are a lot of girls on each floor to deal with

job_title: Graduate Assistant Baseball Coach in Hillsboro, KS
pros: Great people but small school and town.  Have to be willing to adjust to small environment.  People are very friendly and always wiling to help.
cons: Not realistic with money and time commitment. Need to make some adjustments to make life easier for GAs.

review_title: An experience that deteriorates self worth
pros:
If you like to contribute to young people and like a small
Intimate community to work in this is the place. Also if you like small towns where everyone knows everyone
cons:
Worse of  salaries at college Level in 
nation;  some employees are below poverty level if have children while a multimillion dollar. Building is going up.

pros: You have the opportunity to help kids that couldn't succeed at a conventional college or university.  These are students with a lack of academic motivation.
cons: Acceptance of diverse ideas and backgrounds is a falsehood Tabor likes to present to the outside.  Working for Tabor is a whole different beast. It's all about getting MORE,MORE,MORE MONEY.

pros: Freedom to design coursework, goals and student expectations
cons: Not all student had prerequisite coursework to be successful.

pros: Christian Commitment,  There are some nice people here.
cons: Low low wages and very tight budget
